Just give people a UBI and call it a day. I don't care about the environment, I just need cash. Maybe then I'll start to care

topic.title: How to tell Facts from Opinions.. for Dummies:
topic.body:
1. Ask yourself.. what is more likely to be the truth? e.g. That Mark Zuckerberg is secretly a lizard.. or that he's just a really socially awkward guy high on Modafinil?
2. If we're talking about an interpretation of a recent world event.. How many verified sources support this claim? Is it just 1-2 articles from the Daily Wire and The Sun.... or 100-200 articles and blog posts from **actual journalists** and people from a variety of different political leanings?
3. Again, if we're talking about an unusual interpretation of a recent event.. Does the person possess convincing video footage, or photographs? Is there ANY evidence that the footage has been tampered with? Is there ANY evidence that the video footage is.. something else entirely, and nothing to do with the event at hand?
4. Is the person giving out their opinion, truly open minded and serious about wanting to discover the truth.. or are they motivated by a political agenda, money or a desire for fame?
5. If we're talking about a scientific fact.. how many scientists actually support this opinion? e.g. How many actual, qualified scientists support Flat Earth theory vs. how many don't.
6. Again, If we're talking about something being claimed to be a scientific fact.. can this 'theory' be validated using the Scientific Method?
7. Most importantly, just remember that a lot of the times, reality is just boring and predictable. Not everything is as exciting and mysterious as it is in Movies, comic books and film. Sometimes, the mainstream opinion is what is most likely to be right.

Otherwise, we'd all be fighting over whose reality is the Real reality.. and we'd never have a functioning society ever again.

topic.title: Will being Human one day be considered a Mental Illness?
topic.body:
Being unsatisfied with the bare minimum, having a desire to live a more exciting life than just the 9-5 grind, having individuality, being rowdy and obnoxious, having unpopular political beliefs, speaking your mind, loving motorcycles, booze, guns and explosions, etc.

Pretty sure all of these things will be considered a mental illness some day, and will be engineered out of the human DNA so that societies can operate more efficiently. Or you can just give people highly advanced anti-depressants to get them to be happy with owning nothing.

Sometimes I have the feeling that Trump supporters had valid concerns about governments infringing on individual liberty and freedoms, especially with our new worldwide coronavirus surveillance state.

Of course, I don't see how Trump isn't just a different side of the same coin. Maybe they just saw an opportunity to stick it to the institutions that looked down on them, at the risk of inviting more government tyranny and political opportunists into their lives.

Like, when I was watching the videos on All Gas No Brakes, many people in the comments accused the interviewees of being 'mentally ill'.. simply because they're rowdy and obnoxious Trumpers.

But don't we all say stupid shit every now and then? Should all those people be forcefully detained and medicated against their will for the betterment of society?

Is modern life making us mentally ill? Or could it be that a lot of what we call 'mental illness' is just normal human behavior that is now considered pathological and detrimental to the development of a more technologically advanced and 'perfect' society?

topic.title: The Game Theory problem of Social Media alternatives.
topic.body:
With the rise in political polarization and platforms such as Truth Social, Parler, Bitchute, etc. there seems to be an emerging pattern:

- As nationwide political polarization and animosity rises, so does censorship.
- As people are censored from mainstream spaces, they go underground.
- As they go underground, those platforms end up becoming 'ban-evasion refugee camps'
- The 'ban-evasion refugee camps' may initially just be filled with the far-right and white supremacists.
- But as even worse types of offenders (pedophiles, actual terrorists, scammers, etc.) are banned from mainstream platforms, they wind up populating the 'ban-evasion refugee camps'.
- You end up with a platform exclusively filled with the worst types of people imaginable.
- Newcomers are put off when they see a forum full of nazis and pedophiles.
- Mainstream platforms then get away with their rampant censorship and authoritarianism because it's better than the alternatives. Everything on the internet just starts to suck. And then all that shittiness spills over into the real world.
- Everyone goes batsh*t crazy and you end up with a Mad Max clown world.

Solutions:
- Create social media platforms with 'common sense' levels of censorship, similar to what YouTube back in 2005-2010 used to be. Ban kiddie porn, explicitly violent videos of e.g. massacres and rampages, etc. 
- Create an AI algorithm that gradually exposes people to different types of political opinions, rather than just allowing them to live in a bubble surrounded by people who agree with them.
- Have a 60 second delay e.g. when Tweeting, allow people to edit and think about what they're about to tweet.
- Democratically elected moderators.
- Stop creating new 'Decentralized Internets'. Instead, revive the old ones and carry on working on them. Otherwise, you'll have your userbase scattered all over.
- Use well-maintained web proxies in order to encourage the use of ZeroNet (last time I tried to create one using a Google VPS, I failed, but I'll try again on my own computer first see if there's something wrong with the new version of ZeroNet that stops this from happening.)

topic.title: We need a non-partisan battle against pandemic Tyranny
topic.body:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MxwtlV2eCz4

So it turns out, Israel is still facing surges in Covid19 infections despite the high rates in vaccination compliance. Which means we have a big problem on our hands.

People are inviting a regime of terror, surveillance and totalitarian control for a small amount of comfort. The comfort that they won't face the tiny chance of dying at the hands of a respiratory infection, despite the numerous other things that could kill us at any given moment.. like obesity, addiction, diabetes, heart disease, etc.

Lockdowns have led to a rise in homicides and of course supply chain shortages, economic devastation and political turmoil.

Despite wearing masks and social distancing, And receiving the vaccine - I'm still forced to quarantine right now. I put in all that effort just to end up penniless and locked up in my room anyway. 

We need a non-partisan battle against covid19 restrictions. With an emphasis on non-partisan, as lockdown protestors frequently push other agendas such as White nationalism, right-wing populism, etc.

It's time to open up. But even if we open up people are still going to be paranoid and drenched in fear, especially family members. This is a mess and I can't see myself taking another day of it.

topic.title: I was wrong about Politics for the past 10 years
topic.body:
The global elite and feudalist orchestrators of the Great Reset are laughing all the way to be bank right now.. for the people have been successfully divided and conquered by culture wars and identity politics.

We need a Class War.

1611909944_1HTbdyz4zToxkxfmuYYfNVN1Y3U2y.body: Yeah, don't take the vaccines kiddos. Some dude on Bitchute told me not to

> [getoutofthis](#comment_9_13UNccDwDNZx97EtsahFYrU3e5u4YGFbs7): @quantumkitty is a NPC that truly believes that whenever someone  has another opinion than itself, the reason is always that the other person must be stupid. It can not believe that other people do genuinely have another worldview than itself based on experience, knowledge, logic and true facts.

Yes, but opinions aren't facts

> [getoutofthis](#comment_10_13UNccDwDNZx97EtsahFYrU3e5u4YGFbs7): How do you tell opinions apart from facts?

Well, a lot of the times it's just basic common sense.

If a car accident happens while I'm driving to work. What's the most likely explanation: Shit happens, or the government deliberately tried to assassinate the driver?

> [grouch0](#comment_32_1CrFEcv59gAFWe7w5wbKxCYJg3sDg48tUt): Common sense? That analogy doesn't make sense, unless everyone involved in car accidents is insignificant and represents no threat to any other interested party. There are plenty of examples which demonstrate that death resulting from car accidents have been instigated by governments or third-parties. Dianna Spencer and Dodi Al-fayed would be but one of many examples, which contradict your analogy.  [...]

Yes, because ->

You can't just go around making shit up. You need concrete, solid, irrefutable evidence of something before you claim it as a fact.. like saying Earth is flat.

Like, say, if you wanted to prove that 9/11 was an inside job.. it would require a minimum of actual video footage of somebody planting bombs in the twin tower in order for your theory to be proven true and correct. And it has to be verified by multiple sources, not just fucking Daily Wire.. because video falsification technology is getting a lot better these days.

And until that strong piece of evidence is found, you're out of luck. The mainstream story is what is probably true.

I swear.. One of these days someone is going to claim that Trump is secretly antifa.. and then all of those right-wingers are going to go to his house and beat the crap out of him. Because they're borderline friggen retarded.. lol
